citation.article-title: Lachnobacterium bovis gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel bacterium isolated from the rumen and faeces of cattle.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Lachnobacterium (Lach.no.bac.te'ri.um.Gr. n. lachnos woolly hair, down; L. dim. n. bakterion a small rod; N.L. neut. n. Lachnobacterium woolly rod, after its colonial morphology on agar)
Cells are long straight rods occurring as chains or filaments.
Products from glucose fermentation are primarily lactic acid with very minor amounts of acetic and butyric acid.
The type species is Lachnobacterium bovis.
The genus Lachnobacterium is a member of the Clostridium subphylum of Gram-positive bacteria.
